info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 9 at 5:03PM EDT until July 9 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell, Lexington and Orangeburg.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 503 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cayce, Barnwell, Denmark, Williston, Blackville, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, Barnwell State Park, Aiken State Park, SC State Farmer's Market, Swansea, Wagener, North, Pelion, Springfield, Hilda, Salley, Neeses and Norway. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 117 and 120. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 37 and 43. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Aiken, SC; Bamberg, SC; Barnwell, SC; Lexington, SC; Orangeburg, SC
